meanings.definition: Either of the two times in the year when the sun is at its greatest distance from the celestial equator
meanings.sent1: During the solstice, the sun seems to stand still in the sky.
meanings.sent2: People celebrate the summer solstice with bonfires and feasts.
meanings.sent3: At the solstice, the sun plays hide-and-seek with the clouds.
meanings.sent4: The winter solstice marks the longest night of the year.
meanings.sent5: The solstice is like a cosmic balancing act between light and darkness.

meanings.definition: A furthest or culminating point; a turning point
meanings.sent1: The solstice of his career came when he won the championship.
meanings.sent2: Their argument reached a solstice when they finally agreed to compromise.
meanings.sent3: The solstice of the movie was when the hero saved the day in a surprising way.
meanings.sent4: The company's financial solstice was when they went public and saw massive success.
meanings.sent5: The solstice of her journey was when she reached the mountain's summit against all odds.
